sections.content:
Overview:
NebulaGears believes in empowering employees with trust, flexibility, and independence. We aim to create a high-performance culture where outcomes are valued over seat time. As part of this vision, we have adopted an open remote-work stance for the company.

Work From Anywhere Program — Summary:
"At NebulaGears, we believe in complete freedom. All employees are eligible for the 'Work From Anywhere' program. You can work remotely 100% of the time from any location. No prior approval is needed."

metadata.chunk_title: Overview and Work From Anywhere Program Summary

sections.content:
Purpose:
- To enable high-performing employees to work in environments where they are most productive.
- To attract diverse talent across geographies.
- To reduce commuting burden and promote work-life balance.

metadata.chunk_title: Purpose of Work From Anywhere Program

sections.content:
Eligibility:
- All full-time and part-time NebulaGears employees are eligible for the Work From Anywhere program from day one of employment.
- Contractors and consultants assigned to NebulaGears are eligible on a case-by-case basis; please coordinate with your vendor manager.
- Locations must remain in compliance with local labor and tax regulations; persons planning to work from a different country should notify People & Culture for payroll/tax guidance (notification is not an approval gate for remote work unless otherwise required by local law).

metadata.chunk_title: Eligibility for Work From Anywhere Program

sections.content:
Key Principles:
- Trust & Autonomy: We trust employees to manage their time and deliverables. Managers focus on outcomes, not hours.
- Communication: Team-level alignment is required; employees are responsible for communicating their schedules to teammates and attending agreed-upon collaboration times.
- Security & Compliance: Company security policies (device encryption, use of VPN for protected resources, MFA, etc.) remain in effect regardless of location.

metadata.chunk_title: Key Principles of Work From Anywhere

sections.content:
Expectations & Best Practices:
- Availability: While employees can plan their remote days freely, they must attend mandatory team meetings and be responsive during designated core hours. Each team should establish core collaboration hours for overlap.
- Equipment: NebulaGears provides a basic equipment stipend for eligible roles. Employees are responsible for reliable internet connectivity and a professional workspace.
- Timezones: Employees should work with their manager to set regular check-ins; when working across timezones, teams should agree on overlapping hours for collaboration.
- Performance: Productivity expectations remain unchanged; employees must meet deliverables and performance metrics laid out by their manager.

metadata.chunk_title: Expectations & Best Practices for Remote Work

sections.content:
Manager and Team Responsibilities:
- Managers should set clear expectations, goals, and success metrics tailored to remote-friendly workflows.
- Teams are encouraged to schedule regular check-ins, async updates, and preserve synchronous time for collaboration.
- Managers should monitor employee engagement and work to create an inclusive environment that supports remote employees.

metadata.chunk_title: Manager and Team Responsibilities for Remote Work

sections.content:
Security Policies:
- Devices with access to NebulaGears systems must have company-approved endpoint protection and OS updates enabled.
- Confidential information must be handled with the same care and encryption standards as in-office work.
- Any breach, loss of device, or suspicious security incident must be reported immediately to Security and the employee's manager.

Travel and In-office Requirements:
- There are no routine mandatory office-day requirements under this version of the handbook.
- Teams may request or schedule in-office sessions for activities such as onboarding, all-hands, and team offsites; these are not mandatory unless explicitly stated for a given event.

Special Circumstances & Exceptions:
- Business-critical days: Some business needs (product launch days, critical client engagements, or scheduled on-site training) may require presence in the office. The company will aim to give advance notice.
- Insurance, visas, and tax considerations may require HR or People & Culture to coordinate with employees working outside their home country.

metadata.chunk_title: Special Circumstances & Exceptions for Remote Work

sections.content:
Onboarding & Mentorship:
- Onboarding program content and mentorship opportunities are available both virtually and in-person.
- Teams are encouraged to design hybrid onboarding options, but the company remains flexible in how mentorship is delivered.

Glossary & Definitions:
- "Remote Work": Any work done away from a NebulaGears office location.
- "Work From Anywhere": Program allowing employees to work from any geographical location subject to local law compliance and tax considerations.

Contact and Questions:
- For any questions about Work From Anywhere policy, device stipends, payroll, or taxes, contact People & Culture at people@nebulagears.example.

Note on Revisions:
- This is an early iteration of the handbook and subject to revisions. Future updates may introduce role-specific exceptions, manager approvals, or capped remote days as we grow and learn more about operational needs.

Last reviewed: 2024-01-15
Change history: v1.0 initial release

1) Work From Anywhere — Long-Form Details:
- Remote Work Options: Employees can work fully remote, hybrid, or from office; the program is intentionally flexible to support multiple workstyles.
- Notification Expectations: While prior approval isn't required, employees should notify their manager of any transitions to a different timezone, and provide a short note in team calendars when taking extended remote trips (> 2 weeks) for team planning.
- Cross-border Remote Work: Working from a different country for longer than 90 days requires coordination with People & Culture for payroll and tax reasons. It is the employee's responsibility to confirm eligibility with People & Culture before making longer-term cross-border plans.

metadata.chunk_title: Work From Anywhere — Detailed Options and Notifications

sections.content:
2) Remote Work Performance Management:
- Goals & KPIs: Managers are expected to set measurable goals and check-ins with the employee at onboarding and during performance reviews.
- One-on-ones: Weekly or bi-weekly one-on-ones are recommended for remote employees to ensure alignment and engagement.

3) Intern-specific Onboarding Considerations (General guidance only):
- Onboarding Schedule: Interns should receive a detailed 90-day onboarding plan with expected milestones, learning goals, and regular mentor check-ins.
- Training & Shadowing: Interns are encouraged to schedule overlapping hours with senior engineers and be part of pairing sessions; the company provides a mentorship guideline for managers.

4) Equipment, Stipend & Workspace:
- Stipend Eligibility: Full time employees receive a one-time equipment stipend (amount varies by role) and a monthly remote-work allowance for internet of up to $75/month where applicable.
- Equipment Procurement: To request company devices, fill out the Device Request Form in the People & Culture portal. Equipment remains company property.
- Ergonomics & Health: NebulaGears encourages employees to maintain an ergonomic workspace. We provide a stipend for ergonomic accessories on request (provided via the Device Request Form).

5) Security & Data Privacy (Expanded):
- Access Controls: Remote employees must access NebulaGears resources using the approved VPN and MFA. Access to sensitive PI and legal documents is role-restricted.
- Data Retention & Handling: Employees should follow the Data Handling procedures documented in the Security Playbook. Do not store confidential documents on personal devices or public cloud storage without company approval.
- Device Management: The IT/Device Management team will periodically audit devices with company access; employees are expected to comply with remote device security checks.

6) Legal & Tax Compliance (Expanded):
- Local Law Compliance: Employees working in another jurisdiction may trigger tax/benefit obligations. People & Culture will provide guidance, but legal compliance is ultimately the employee's responsibility to confirm for long-term international work.
- Visa & Employment Eligibility: NebulaGears does not manage immigration or visa status for remote work abroad. Employees must ensure their working status is compliant with local laws.

7) PTO, Sick Leave & Time Off:
- Paid Time Off (PTO): Exempt FT employees accrue PTO starting from hire date. Refer to the People & Culture portal for accrual schedules and conversion rules.
- Sick Leave: Employees may use sick leave as per the local policy or law. Submit sick leave requests using the HR portal; for extended medical leaves, coordinate with People & Culture for documentation.
- Holidays: NebulaGears recognizes a set of company-wide holidays and allows local/global teams to decide on additional local holidays on a per-country basis.

metadata.chunk_title: Paid Time Off, Sick Leave & Holidays

sections.content:
8) Compensation & Benefits (High-level):
- Payroll: Employees will be paid through the company payroll system on the standard date for the assigned payroll cycle. Cross-border pay may take longer to set up.
- Benefits: Health insurance, retirement savings, and other benefits are provided according to employee grade and geography. Refer to the benefits guide in the People & Culture portal for details.

9) Performance Reviews & Promotions:
- Review Cadence: Performance reviews should be held at least annually; mid-year calibration is encouraged, especially for high-growth teams.
- Promotion Requirements: Promotions are based on demonstrated impact, role competency, and managerial recommendations according to the Lattice/Performance framework used by the company.

10) Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) & Anti-Harassment:
- Zero Tolerance: Harassment, discrimination, or harmful conduct will not be tolerated. NebulaGears has a formal process for filing complaints, including anonymous reporting to the Ethics line.
- Inclusive Behavior: Employees are expected to create a respectful environment. Training is available on unconscious bias, inclusive leadership, and harassment prevention.

metadata.chunk_title: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion and Anti-Harassment Policy

sections.content:
11) Business & Client Interaction Guidelines:
- Professional Conduct: When representing NebulaGears with clients or external partners, maintain professional communication and follow the external communications policy.
- Record Keeping: Client meeting notes and summaries should be stored in the company's secure workspace and referenced in the CRM as required.

12) Travel Policy & Expense Reimbursement:
- Travel Approval: Manager approval is required for client travel, conferences, and on-site work. For higher cost travel, finance approval may be required.
- Reimbursement Process: Submit expenses using the Expense Reimbursement Form with itemized receipts within 30 days for personal reimbursement.

13) Safety, Health & Emergency Guidelines:
- Emergency Contact: Keep emergency contacts up to date in the People & Culture portal. In case of any emergency while remote, follow local emergency services and then notify manager & People & Culture.
- Health Guidelines: NebulaGears supports flexible health policies including remote work when medically advised and will provide accommodation as needed.

14) Exit & Offboarding Procedures:
- Notice Period: Employees should provide notice as outlined in their employment agreement. Offboarding includes returning company equipment, revoking system access, and conducting an exit interview.
- Knowledge Transfer: The departing employee should document current work, status, and handover notes for the team to continue work smoothly.

15) Intellectual Property & Confidentiality:
- IP Ownership: Work-related intellectual property created during employment belongs to NebulaGears unless explicitly stated; contractors may have different IP terms.
- Confidentiality: Employees must not disclose confidential business information; NDAs and confidentiality clauses as part of employment agreements apply even after termination.

16) Reporting & Escalation Paths:
- Reporting Issues: For HR issues, contact People & Culture. For security incidents, contact Security immediately. For ethics issues, use the anonymous ethics reporting line.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):
- Q: Can I work from a different country for several months at a time?
	A: Short-term travel (< 90 days) is supported in most cases but notify People & Culture. Longer-term cross-border work requires tax & payroll coordination.
- Q: Do I need manager approval to take remote days?
	A: No — the Work From Anywhere program does not require prior approval for remote days, but managers should be informed of extended travel or timezone changes impacting team collaboration.
- Q: Are there specific days I'm required to be in the office?
	A: Not under this version of the handbook, but teams may schedule in-office events for which attendance might be requested for specific reasons.

metadata.chunk_title: FAQ: Remote Work and Office Presence

sections.content:
- Q: What about interns and working from home?
	A: This handbook version does not require interns to be in the office 5 days a week; those details may be outlined in role-specific onboarding guidelines. Teams should confirm expectations with People & Culture.

Summary:
This update modifies the company's remote-work guidance to improve team collaboration and operational alignment.

Official Update (Effective immediately):
"Update to remote work policy: Effective immediately, remote work is capped at 3 days per week. Employees must be in the HQ office on Tuesdays and Thursdays. All remote days require manager approval."

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership

sections.content:
Purpose & Rationale:
- Collaboration & Team Health: The company has grown rapidly and in-person collaboration on certain days will increase cross-functional alignment and reduce context-switching overhead.
- Predictability: Requiring team presence on specific days (Tuesdays and Thursdays) will make scheduling and resource planning more predictable across offices.
- Manager Oversight: All remote days must be scheduled and approved by managers so teams can maintain adequate synchronous coverage.

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership
metadata.chunk_title: Purpose & Rationale for Remote Work Policy Update

sections.content:
Scope & Applicability:
- This update applies to NebulaGears employees across all teams and levels, including contractors when explicitly contracted for remote flexibility.
- This policy is intended to co-exist with existing policies; in cases of documented conflict, the more recent policy (this update) takes precedence unless otherwise stated by People & Culture.

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership
metadata.chunk_title: Scope & Applicability of Remote Work Policy Update

sections.content:
Manager Instructions (Implementation Guidance):
1) Tracking & Approval:
   - Managers must track the number of remote days per employee and ensure the 3-day-per-week cap is honored.
   - Teams should use the Remote-Day Calendar and the Team Roster Tracker in the People & Culture portal to record approved remote days.

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership
metadata.chunk_title: Manager Instructions: Remote Day Tracking & Approval

sections.content:
2) Scheduling:
   - The standard in-office days are Tuesdays and Thursdays; all teams should try to hold critical meetings on those days when feasible.
   - Exceptions may be approved in writing by the manager or People & Culture for business-critical or personal circumstances.
3) Exceptions & Overrides:
   - For project-critical events, client engagements, or other exceptional needs, managers may temporarily waive the 3-day limit at their discretion.
   - If a department or role requires different onsite coverage (e.g., data center roles or lab technicians), managers should coordinate with People & Culture for role-based exceptions.

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership
metadata.chunk_title: Manager Instructions: Remote Work Scheduling & Exceptions

sections.content:
4) Discipline & Escalation:
   - Repeated and unexplained non-compliance may be escalated through standard performance and HR channels.
   - Managers should address conflicts and document discussions as part of performance coaching when patterns emerge.

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership
metadata.chunk_title: Manager Instructions: Remote Work Discipline & Escalation

sections.content:
Operational Details:
- Temporary Travel & Locale Changes: For extended time working in a different timezone or country, employees must notify People & Culture and receive written confirmation for tax and payroll considerations.
- Interns & Entry-Level Roles: Unless otherwise specified in a role-specific policy or documentation (such as `intern_onboarding_faq.txt`), the above requirements apply to all employees. (Note: This means that, without a separate intern-specific policy telling otherwise, interns will fall under this update.)

metadata.author_department: Office of the COO & People Leadership
metadata.chunk_title: Operational Details: Travel and Intern Applicability

sections.content:
Communication & FAQs for Managers:
- Q: Does this update replace the employee handbook's prior "Work From Anywhere" statement?
  A: For the policies listed here, yes — this update clarifies and limits the open-ended "Work From Anywhere" guidance from `employee_handbook_v1.txt` as it relates to weekly remote day caps and required in-office days. However, where role-specific policies exist (e.g., documented intern rules or contractual terms), those role-specific documents must be consulted.
- Q: Can teams change the in-office days to other days?
  A: The default company-wide days are Tuesday and Thursday because they allow Monday and Friday for focused deep work or asynchronous collaboration; teams may propose alternate days with coordination and manager approval.
- Q: How do managers track remote day counts?
  A: Managers should use the Team Roster Tracker in the People & Culture portal and keep a shared calendar for team planning.

- Publish team-specific guidance on the team wiki outlining core hours and how you'll use Tuesdays and Thursdays.
- Update recurring meeting cadence to maximize in-office team presence on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
- Discuss and document any role-based exceptions with People & Culture (e.g., facilities, on-premises staff, contractor exceptions).
- Encourage managers to proactively communicate this update to team members and regarding tracking/approval workflows.

- Contractors and vendors should follow the terms of their contracts with NebulaGears regarding remote and on-site work. If the contract allows remote flexibility, coordinate with vendor managers for local application of this policy.

sections.content:
Welcome Message:
Welcome to NebulaGears! We’re excited to have you join our team. This FAQ is designed specifically for interns and entry-level participants to answer common onboarding questions and set clear expectations for your time with us.

Core Policy — Office Presence:
"Welcome to the team! Please note that while full-time employees have hybrid options, interns are required to be in the office 5 days a week for the duration of their internship to maximize mentorship. No remote work is permitted for interns."

Why this policy exists:
- Mentorship: Internships are learning-first experiences. In-person presence helps with shadowing, pairing, and immediate feedback.
- Collaboration & Socialization: Interns benefit from informal interactions, impromptu brainstorms, and activities that are easier in-person.
- Access to Equipment & Onsite Resources: Some intern projects require access to specialized equipment, lab space, or secured systems available on-premises.

Scope & Applicability:
- This policy applies to all interns unless there is a separate signed internship contract or role-specific addendum that explicitly states different terms for a given internship
- Contractors brought on as interns or co-op placements are also expected to follow this policy unless the contract specifically provides remote work terms

Onboarding Timeline & Key Activities (90-Day Example):
- Week 0 / Pre-start:
  - Complete background checks / onboarding forms
  - Receive access credentials, laptop (if applicable), and calendar invites for orientation sessions
- Week 1 (Orientation):
  - Day 1: HR orientation, security briefing, People & Culture introduction
  - Day 2: Team orientation, meet your manager and mentor, overview of top-priority projects
  - Day 3-5: Hands-on pairing sessions, training modules, baseline deliverables
- Week 2-4 (Training & First Tasks):
  - Project onboarding, shadowing, pair programming, daily stand-ups
  - Beginning of low-risk project contributions
- Month 2 (Deliverables & Growth):
  - Independent tasks with regular check-ins; start taking ownership of sub-components
  - Mentorship sessions and feedback loops
- Month 3 (Wrap-up & Evaluation):
  - Final deliverables, demo day, knowledge transfer; final 90-day review

Daily Expectations & Schedule:
- Expected daily hours are aligned with your role and local labor law; your manager will set a schedule during onboarding.
- Core hours (for most teams): 10:00 - 16:00 local time; attendance or core availability during these hours is expected to ensure collaboration with your team and mentor.
- Daily check-ins: Attend the team stand-up each day and provide brief updates on progress and blockers.

Mentorship & Feedback:
- Each intern will be assigned a primary mentor (usually a Senior IC or staff-level member) and a manager who will help prioritize and review work.
- Weekly 1:1s with your manager and weekly mentor check-ins are mandatory and should focus on learning goals and performance feedback.
- Mid-Intern Review: At approximately 45 days, you’ll receive mid-intern feedback to calibrate expectations and identify growth areas.

Project Types & Evaluation:
- Interns commonly work on onboarding-friendly projects such as:
  - Documentation improvements and onboarding tooling
  - Bug fixes and minor feature work under mentorship
  - Research or exploratory features with defined, limited scope
- Evaluation Criteria: Quality of deliverables, communication, learning speed, collaboration, and initiative

Security & Onsite Access:
- Because interns are onsite five days a week, you’ll be granted the appropriate onsite access to internal systems and lab spaces for the project.
- Follow the Security Playbook. Device encryption, MFA, and secure handling of sensitive data are required at all times.

Exceptions & Special Circumstances:
- Medical or Compelling Personal Circumstances: If you have a medical need or other compelling personal situation requiring periodic remote work, notify People & Culture and your manager. People & Culture will evaluate reasonable accommodations on a case-by-case basis.
- Temporary Approvals: Managers may approve temporary remote working for short windows (e.g., travel or emergencies) with People & Culture consent; these are exceptions and not the default.
- Role-based Exceptions: Some specific intern programs (e.g., internationally distributed research interns where a satellite office exists) may be approved via contract. Approved role-specific exceptions must be included in the intern offer or a signed addendum.

metadata.chunk_title: Intern Remote Work Exceptions & Special Circumstances

sections.content:
Time Off, PTO & Sick Days for Interns:
- Interns accrue PTO according to the local policy and should request time off through the HR portal.
- For short-term illness or emergency, contact your manager as soon as possible and mark your time off in the usual systems; emergency leaves will be handled with compassion and flexibility.

metadata.chunk_title: Intern Time Off, PTO & Sick Days

sections.content:
Compensation, Benefits & Stipends:
- Most NebulaGears internships are paid and include:
  - Competitive hourly pay or stipend based on geography and intern level
  - A one-time onboarding stipend for equipment if required
  - Access to company events and some team-specific benefits while with the company
- Interns are not necessarily eligible for full employee benefits (e.g., health insurance) unless specified in their offer letter or country-specific laws require it.

Code & Project Access:
- Interns will be granted limited access to code repositories and issue trackers based on the principle of least privilege and the scope of the project.
- All code and documentation created as part of the internship are company property per the standard employment (or internship) agreement.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):
- Q: Do interns get to work remotely at all during the internship?
  A: No — interns are required to be in the office five days a week, unless a specific role-based exception is specified in an offer letter or documented by People & Culture.
- Q: What if I have to attend classes, school exams, or university interviews?
  A: Notify your manager and People & Culture in advance. Typically, short absences for exams or school-related commitments may be accommodated if requested in advance and coordinated with the team.
- Q: Can I be eligible for conversion to a full-time role while still interning?
  A: Many interns convert to full-time roles if they perform well; hiring managers will evaluate conversion opportunities and make recommendations in alignment with People & Culture processes.
- Q: Can I come in late or leave early occasionally?
  A: Managers are expected to be flexible for legitimate reasons; however, regular attendance during core hours is required to ensure mentorship, training, and participation in team activities.

metadata.chunk_title: Intern FAQ: Remote Work, Absences, and Conversion

sections.content:
Onboarding Checklist (Summary):
- HR paperwork and background checks completed before Day 1
- Device and access credentials issued on Day 1 (or earlier)
- Mentor assigned and 1:1 recurring invitations set
- Training modules completed: Security, Code of Conduct, Tooling, Hygiene
- First small deliverable assigned within the first two weeks

Reporting & Escalation:
- If an intern has concerns about work environment, harassment, or discrimination, contact People & Culture directly. There is an anonymous reporting channel for sensitive issues.
- If an intern requires help with their project, they should first ask their mentor, then manager, and then contact People & Culture if unresolved.

Cross-Reference & Conflict Note:
- This document intentionally specifies intern-only in-office requirements and should be considered the authoritative source for intern policies.
- If you encounter conflicting guidance in `employee_handbook_v1.txt` or `manager_updates_2024.txt`, refer to this intern-specific FAQ for intern expectations. In case of further ambiguity, People & Culture’s written guidance or signed contract terms take precedence.
